title: Step-By-Step Guide to Scan Documents from a Canon Printer

steps.title: Make sure that your Canon printer can scan.
steps.content: Make sure that your Canon printer can scan. If your printer is an "all-in-one" model, it can scan. Some other printer models can scan as well, though you'll need to check the printer's documentation or product page to ensure that this is the case.

steps.title: Connect your printer to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your printer to your computer. Most Canon printers that can scan will also be able to connect wirelessly via a touch-screen panel, but you may need to connect your printer to your computer via USB cable.

steps.title: Download and install the printer drivers and utilities.
steps.content: Download and install the printer drivers and utilities. If your printer came with a CD or DVD, you can use that to install the drivers for your printer. The printer drivers also come with the IJ Scan Utility that you can use to scan documents . [1] X Research source If it did not come with a CD or DVD, use the following steps to download the drivers for your printer: Go to www.usa.canon.com/support/software-and-drivers in your web browser. Click Printers . Select your model number or enter your model number in the search bar and press Enter . Select your operating system using the drop-down menu next to "Operating System." (If drivers aren't available for your operating system, you may not need to install drivers). Click Select next to the drivers you want to download. Click Download . Open the installation file and follow the instructions.

steps.title: Turn on your printer if necessary.
steps.content: Turn on your printer if necessary. Press the printer's "On" button. If the printer won't turn on, make sure that it's connected to a working power source.

steps.title: Open the scanner.
steps.content: Open the scanner. Lift up the scanner's lid so that you can see the glass bottom of the scanner.

steps.title: Place your document face-down in the scanner.
steps.content: Place your document face-down in the scanner. Look for an arrow in the back-left corner and align the document with that arrow. Your document should be aligned with the top and left side of the glass. [2] X Research source If your Canon printer has an automatic document feeder, insert the document into the automatic document feeder tray face up. Align the guides on the side to the width of your document. You should hear a beep when the document is inserted properly. Consult your Canon's instruction manual if you can't figure out how to use the built-in scanner.

steps.title: Close the scanner lid.
steps.content: Close the scanner lid. Make sure that it is firmly shut before you scan your document.

steps.title: Navigate to the IJ Scan Utility folder.
steps.content: Navigate to the IJ Scan Utility folder. Use one of the following steps to navigate to the IJ Scan Utility folder on PC and Mac: [3] X Research source Windows: Click the Windows Start button. Open the Canon Utilities folder. Mac: Click Go in the menu bar at the top. Click Applications . Open the Canon Utilities folder. Open the IJ Scan Utility folder.

steps.title: Launch the IJ Scan Utility.
steps.content: Launch the IJ Scan Utility. It has an icon that resembles a document next to a scanner. Click the icon in the IJ Scan Utility folder. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's in the lower-right corner of the IJ Scan Utility app. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Document Scan.
steps.content: Click Document Scan . It's the second option in the menu to the left. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select "PDF (Multiple Pages)".
steps.content: Select "PDF (Multiple Pages)". To do so, click the drop-down menu next to "Data Format" and select PDF (Multiple Pages) . This allows you to scan multiple pages into one document. Some printers can be set to automatically scan both sides of a document. If this option is available on your printer, select "Document (ADF/Platen)" in the drop-down menu next to "Select source" to activate it.

steps.title: Select a save location and click Ok.
steps.content: Select a save location and click Ok . Use the drop-down menu next to "Save in" to select a save location for your documents. Then click Ok . By default, documents will be saved to your "Documents" folder.

steps.title: Click Document.
steps.content: Click Document . It's the second option in the IJ Scan Utility window. It has an icon that says "PDF" next to a document. This starts scanning your page. It may take a minute to finish. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Insert the next page and click Scan.
steps.content: Insert the next page and click Scan . If you have more than one page to scan, place the next page on the glass scanner or in the automatic document feeder. Make sure the document is lined up with the arrow in the back-left corner of the glass scanner. Click Scan when you are ready to scan the next page.

steps.title: Click Exit.
steps.content: Click Exit . Once you are finished scanning every page of your document, click Exit . Your document will be saved as a PDF file inside your Documents folder, or wherever you chose to save your documents. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Type windows fax and scan into Start.
steps.content: Type windows fax and scan into Start. Doing so will search for the Windows Fax and Scan app.

steps.title: Click Windows Fax and Scan.
steps.content: Click Windows Fax and Scan . It's at the top of the Start window. The Fax and Scan app will open.

steps.title: Click New Scan.
steps.content: Click New Scan . This is in the upper-left side of the Fax and Scan window. Clicking it opens a new window.

steps.title: Make sure that your scanner is correct.
steps.content: Make sure that your scanner is correct. You should see the word "Canon" and your printer's model number. If you see something else here, click Change... and select your Canon printer.

steps.title: Select a type of document.
steps.content: Select a type of document. Click the "Profile" drop-down box, then select the type of document (e.g., Photo ) in the drop-down box.

steps.title: Decide on your document's color.
steps.content: Decide on your document's color. Click the "Color format" drop-down box, then select either Color or Black and White . Your scanner may have additional (or limited) options for color formatting.

steps.title: Select a file type.
steps.content: Select a file type. Click the "File type" drop-down box, then click the file type (e.g., PDF or JPG ) that you want to use to store the scanned document on your computer. [9] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Change any other options on the page.
steps.content: Change any other options on the page. Depending on your scanner, you may have other options (e.g., "Resolution") that you can modify prior to scanning your document.

steps.title: Click Preview.
steps.content: Click Preview . It's at the bottom of the window. Doing so will bring up a preview of your document in the scanner.

steps.title: Click Scan.
steps.content: Click Scan . It's at the bottom of the window. Your document will begin scanning into your computer. [10] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To find the scanned file later, do the following: Open Start Open File Explorer Click Documents on the left side of the window. Double-click the Scanned Documents folder.

steps.title: Open the Apple menu.
steps.content: Open the Apple menu. Click the Apple logo in the top-left corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click System Settings….
steps.content: Click System Settings… . It's at the top of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Printers & Scanners.
steps.content: Click Printers & Scanners . Scroll down in the left-hand menu pane to find this option.

steps.title: Select your Canon printer.
steps.content: Select your Canon printer. Click the "Canon" option in the list of printers in the main menu pane. If you don’t see it, click Add Printer, Scanner, or Fax… and select it from the list of printers detected on your network, then click Add .

steps.title: Click Open Scanner….
steps.content: Click Open Scanner… . This option is near the top of the printer window.

steps.title: Click Show Details.
steps.content: Click Show Details . It's in the lower-right side of the window. This will prompt your scanner to do a quick preview scan, and will also open a window where you can adjust your scan settings.

steps.title: Select a file type.
steps.content: Select a file type. Click the "Format" drop-down box, then click a file type (e.g., PDF or JPEG ) that you want to use to save your file.

steps.title: Decide on a color.
steps.content: Decide on a color. Click the "Kind" drop-down box at the top of the page, then select a color option (e.g., Black & White , Color , or Text ). Your scanner may have limited options here.

steps.title: Select a storage location.
steps.content: Select a storage location. Click the "Scan To" drop-down box, then click a folder in which you want to save your scanned document (e.g., Desktop ).

steps.title: Change other options on the page.
steps.content: Change other options on the page. Depending on the type of file that you're scanning, you may want to change the "Resolution" value or the "Orientation" value here. A higher resolution will result in a larger, higher-quality scan. You can also set the size of your scan in pixels. The orientation determines if your image scans in portrait or landscape mode. Mac’s scanner utility also has some basic image correction features built in. Experiment with using these if you don’t like how the scanned image looks.

steps.title: Click Scan.
steps.content: Click Scan . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. Your document will begin scanning into your computer. When it finishes, you'll be able to find it in your selected save location.
